data.title: Kikkoman Nine Month Profit Increases Nearly 13%
data.description:
Kikkoman posted a 12.8% year-on-year increase in profit attributable to owners of the parent to 51.3 billion yen in the fiscal nine months ended Dec. 31,Â 2024 from 45.52 billion yen a year ago driven by strong growth in its domestic and overseas foods segments.

The soy sauce manufacturer's basic earnings per share rose to 53.97 yen from 47.71 yen a year ago, according to a Tokyo Stock Exchange filing on Wednesday.

Revenue grew 8.2% to 535.5 billion yen from 494.9 billion yen.

For the fiscal year ending March 31, the company forecasted attributable profit to increase 9% to 74.6 billion yen, with revenue expected to rise 5.3% to 695.70 billion yen, and operating profit to grow 11.8% to 74.60 billion yen.

It plans to pay a year-end dividend of 11 yen per share, bringing the total annual dividend to 21 yen per share.

data.title: Alphabet flubs, Yen surges, China returns
data.description:
A look at the day ahead in U.S. and global markets from Mike Dolan

As the week's tariff rollercoaster levels out a bit, Wall Street stocks are tilting lower again - clouded by a poor reception for Alphabet's results, lingering China tariff hike plans and fresh interest rate rise speculation in Japan.

U.S. stock futures were back in the red ahead of Wednesday's bell as shares in megacap Alphabet plunged 7% overnight. The drop came amid doubts about the Google parent's cloud computing business, much like Microsoft last week, and anxiety about its huge investment in artificial intelligence - especially in the light of last week's DeepSeek news.

Following the previous day's sideswipe from Beijing on an anti-monopoly probe into Google there, Alphabet said it would spend $75 billion on its AI buildout this year, 29% more than Wall Street expected, and it missed its cloud revenue target.

Adding to the overnight pressure, shares in Advanced Micro Devices fell 9% after the company's AI chip revenue failed to meet lofty expectations.

With a deluge of earnings updates across the world this week, the news on global macro policy did not help either.

Japan's yen surged to its best levels of the year so far after domestic wage numbers rekindled talk of another Bank of Japan rate hike this year.

Japan's December inflation-adjusted real wages rose 0.6% year-on-year thanks to a wintertime bonus bump, with government officials expressing optimism that wage hike momentum is growing.

"We will continue to raise interest rates and adjust the degree of monetary support, if underlying inflation accelerates toward 2% as we project," Kazuhiro Masaki, director-general of the BOJ's monetary affairs department, told parliament.

As Chinese markets returned from the week-long lunar new year holiday, there was a lot to unpack - not least this week's 10% U.S. tariff hikes on Chinese imports, planned retaliation from Beijing by Feb. 10 and the DeepSeek AI developments.

But both mainland China and Hong Kong stock indexes fell on Wednesday as prior day's hopes of a meeting between U.S. President Donald Trump and China's President Xi Jinping to avert the tariff war were doused. U.S. plans to slap tariffs on Canada and Mexico were postponed for a month this week after similar calls between Trump and the leaders of those countries.

Trump said late on Tuesday he was in no hurry to speak to Xi. White House spokeswoman Karoline Leavitt told reporters a Trump-Xi call still needed to be scheduled.

EMPLOYMENT NUMBERS

Adding to the tension, the U.S. Postal Service said it would temporarily suspend parcels from China and Hong Kong as Trump ended a trade provision this week used by retailers including Temu and Shein to ship low-value packages duty-free to America.

And in the background, private sector business surveys showed China's services activity expanded at a slower pace in January, with the Lunar New Year holidays worsening employment.

The currency reaction was a bit more mixed, however. While the onshore yuan , guided closely by the People's Bank of China, was reset slightly weaker after the holiday break, the offshore yuan strengthened for the second day.

The combination of yen and yuan gains weighed on the dollar index more broadly.

And a retreat in U.S. Treasury yields dragged on the greenback to boot, with the 10-year slipping back below 4.5%.

Treasury yields ebbed on a mix of trade war angst and the latest employment update, which showed U.S. job openings falling more than expected in December. That takes some of the perceived heat out of the labor market and allows more wiggle room for the Federal Reserve to keep easing policy.

"I continue to see a gradual reduction in the level of monetary policy restraint placed on the economy as we move toward a more neutral stance," Fed Vice Chair Philip Jefferson said on Tuesday. "That said, I do not think we need to be in a hurry to change our stance."

Two Fed cuts this year are virtually fully priced for the year - resuming around mid-year.

In a big week for employment numbers, private sector payrolls for January will be released by ADP later on Wednesday and the national payrolls report is due on Friday.

Elsewhere, geopolitical tension added to trade war worries - with Trump's statement on the United States taking over Gaza confounding many who assumed he wanted to withdraw the country from foreign conflicts and remove expensive U.S. military and aid funds from around the world.

Much like the puzzlement over similar contradictions in trade and currency policy, the statement left more confusion about the road ahead.

Gold seemed the only real beneficiary of the uncertainty and set another new record with gains of almost 10% for the year so far.

In other corporate news, the Nikkei newspaper said Japan's Nissan will call off merger talks with rival Honda - abandoning a tie-up that would have created the world's third biggest automaker. Nissan shares fell 4% and Honda's rose 8%.

Key developments that should provide more direction to U.S. markets later on Wednesday:

* U.S. January private sector payrolls from ADP, Jan service sector surveys from ISM and S&PGlobal, December international trade balance; Canada Dec international trade

* Federal Reserve Vice Chair Philip Jefferson, Fed Board Governor Michelle Bowma, Chicago Fed President Austan Goolsbee and Richmond Fed chief Thomas Barkin all speak; European Central Bank chief economist Philip Lane speaks in Washington

* U.S. corporate earnings: Qualcomm, Boston Scientific, Walt Disney, Ford, News Corp, T Rowe Price, MetLife, Uber, Mckesson, Coognizant, Corpay, Allstate, Emereson Electric, Align Technology, Molina, STERIS, Bunge, Johnson Controls, etc

data.title: Euro Rises, But Downturn Likely Ahead
data.description:
The euro strengthened above $1.04 as the US dollar weakened, with investors reacting to the potential economic impact of President Trump's trade tariffs.

These tariffs, along with the threat of future US levies on the European Union, are raising concerns about global growth.

In response to US tariffs, China imposed its own tariffs on US goods, escalating tensions between the worldâs two largest economies.

Meanwhile, in the Eurozone, business activity returned to growth after two months of contraction.

The European Central Bank (ECB) recently cut interest rates and suggested that further cuts could be possible in March.

There are concerns that US tariffs might cause deflationary pressures, potentially prompting the ECB to ease monetary policy even more.

As a result, investors lowered expectations for the ECBâs deposit rate, now predicting it will drop to 1.87% by December.

data.title: North American Morning Briefing: Stock Futures Fall; Google, AMD in Focus
data.description:
OPENING CALL

Stock futures were falling on Wednesday after Google parent Alphabet reported quarterly revenue that missed expectations and as investors awaited talks between Trump and Xi Jinping as the countries levy tariffs on one another.

Bond yields edged lower as fears about tariff-driven inflationary pressures subsided somewhat.

"Investors have grown hopeful that the tariff delays for Mexico and Canada will mean that tariffs are ultimately avoided, whether that's via further delays or some kind of deal," Deutsche Bank said.

"If that does transpire, then that would avoid a major trade shock that hits growth and raises U.S. inflation, hence the more positive market reaction over the last 24 hours."

As tariff angst cools, for now, traders can turn their attention to important economic updates over the next few sessions.

In recent market action:

Chinese stock indexes saw small loses. Benchmarks in mainland China reopened after a public holiday.

European indexes also posted muted falls, while Japan's Nikkei 225 was little changed.

Bitcoin prices fell to around $98,000.

Premarket Movers

Advanced Micro Devices posted a big jump in revenue in its data-center business, but the results undershot analysts' rosy forecasts. Shares fell 9%.

Shares of Alibaba listed in the U.S. fell 2.3%, JD.com declined 3.3%, and PDD Holdings fell 5.9% as the Chinese e-commerce stocks took a hit from plans by the U.S. Postal Service to stop accepting parcels from China and Hong Kong.

Alphabet reported fourth-quarter earnings that beat analysts' estimates but the stock was falling 7.1% after revenue of $96.47 billion missed forecasts of $96.68 billion.

Chipotle Mexican Grill cut its sales outlook for this year, knocking shares. Investors fear President Trump's tariff threats on Mexican and Canadian imports could drive up Chipotle's costs.

Enphase Energy said it anticipates first-quarter sales of between $340 million and $380 million, compared with analysts' consensus of $338 million. Shares rose 6%.

Mattel rose 15% after it forecast higher earnings this year, boosted by greater expected demand for its Barbie dolls. Mattel also announced a stock buyback.

U.S.-listed shares of Novo Nordisk rose 3.7% after it reported fourth-quarter earnings that beat analysts' expectations but forecast slower growth ahead.

Snap posted a surprise quarterly profit and better-than-expected revenue. The stock rose 3%.

Postmarket Movers

Watch For:

International Trade for December; EIA Weekly Petroleum Status Report; Canada International Merchandise Trade for December; Earnings from Ford, Uber, Disney

Today's Top Headlines/Must Reads:

- Options Traders Bet the Rally in Big Tech Stocks Has More Room to Run

- Crypto Industry Looks to New SEC Task Force for Quick Action in Its Favor

- A Hot New Label for Luxury Brands to Consider: 'Made in America'

- China's Lunar New Year Travel, Spending Boom Offer Positive Signs

MARKET WRAPS

Forex:

The dollar continued to trade at softer levels after Tuesday's data showed U.S. job openings fell in December.

The data hints at less pressure on wage growth and potentially more supportive Federal Reserve policy, Swissquote Bank said.

Traders will now turn their focus to ADP private payrolls data and the ISM services report.

The Canadian dollar rose to a two-week high against the dollar as it continued to recover after Trump agreed to pause the tariff, ING said.

The Canadian dollar could rise further if tariff risks are entirely priced out, it said.

There is a residual 1% risk premium embedded into USD/CAD. "That said, we are not sure markets will or should move to a completely optimistic stance on the U.S.-Canada trade spat."

There are no clear hints Canada will be spared from another round of potential universal tariffs. USD/CAD could fall to 1.42 in the short-term but risks remain skewed to 1.45 this summer.

The euro's gains will likely prove limited as it remains broadly unattractive given weak macroeconomic fundamentals and Trump's threats to impose tariffs on the EU, ING said.

Wide eurozone-U.S. interest rate differentials in favor of the dollar reflect these factors, it said.

Trade news will dominate euro price action, although it will be interesting to hear whether the unexpected acceleration in January eurozone inflation triggers some change in the narrative from European Central Bank members.

Bonds:

Uncertainties remain around trade tariffs but easing tensions could improve risk appetite, driving Treasury yields higher, Exness said.

"Uncertainties about further trade developments could leave investors cautious while new decisions from China and the U.S. could fuel volatility," it said.

"Should trade tensions ease, risk appetite could improve, leading to a rebound in yields if traders move out of Treasury bonds."

Energy:

Oil prices edged lower in early trade despite Trump ramping up pressure on Iran.

Trump signed a directive restoring his "maximum pressure" campaign on Tehran with the aim to stop the country from obtaining a nuclear weapon.

Stricter enforcement of sanctions could put as much as 1 million barrels a day of oil supply at risk, according to ING.

"However, reduced flows from Iran will not help in lowering oil prices, something that President Trump is very keen to achieve," it said.

"He would need to see OPEC increase oil output to offset any potential Iranian losses."

Prices are pressured by fears that a trade war between the U.S. and China could hurt global growth and increase inflationary pressures, damping demand for crude.

Metals:

Gold futures rose to a fresh record for the fifth consecutive session on geopolitical uncertainty.

Safe-haven assets continued to see increased demand on growing global uncertainties under Trump's hectic lead, with the prospects that the first weeks of the administration are just a foretaste of what is to come over the next four years, Swissquote Bank said.

Gold is the best hedge for protecting a portfolio from Trump worries, Swissquote said.

More international relations chaos means greater demand--especially from central banks looking to reduce U.S. exposure should Trump turn his focus on their countries, it said.

"At this pace, Trump makes $3,000 look like an easy target."

Pepperstone said gold is mounting a notable bullish rally, fueled by market uncertainty.

Although the USD index initially strengthened earlier in the week, posing a headwind for gold, its retracement helped revive buying interest in the precious metal.

From a technical perspective, gold is testing resistance that could trigger some profit-taking but the broader trend remains supported by hedging activities amid an uncertainty, Pepperstone said.

It sees scope for new record peaks if the risk landscape persists.

TODAY'S TOP HEADLINES

Nissan to Reject Honda Deal to Create World's No. 3 Automaker

TOKYO-Nissan's board is planning to reject Honda's terms for a combination of the two automakers, putting in danger a merger plan announced less than two months ago, people familiar with the matter said Wednesday.

Nissan's board was scheduled to meet later Wednesday, and the people cautioned that no final decision to kill the deal has been made.

EU Sets Out Plans to Crack Down on E-Commerce Platforms Amid Product Safety Concerns

The European Commission is using its raft of digital regulations to target e-commerce platforms like Shein over concerns they are allowing cheap products that might be unsafe or break European Union law to enter the EU.

The commission said on Wednesday it wants to introduce a customs reform that would see platforms hand over data on the products they sell to the EU to give officials more oversight of packages coming into the region.

Venezuela's Citgo Is for Sale-at a Discount

The coming auction for Venezuela's Citgo Petroleum could leave its buyer on the hook to other creditors of the South American country, a stumbling block for the court-ordered sale.

Citgo, among the largest U.S.-based oil refiners, is being auctioned to cover debts owed by its owner, the bankrupt Venezuelan government. Bidders are contending with the risk that U.S. courts could hold Citgo responsible for judgments held by Venezuela's bondholders and other creditors, according to court records and people close to the sale process.

The Rich Are Moving Assets Abroad. What's Prompting the Shift.

Many wealthy individuals are pleased with President Donald Trump's policies-and relieved they won't face the "billionaire's" tax once proposed by the Biden administration. But others are worried, and they aren't waiting to see how Trump's second term will affect the economy, markets, and their personal lives.

These folks are moving assets and investments abroad separately, or in addition to, seeking residency or citizenship in other countries, according to immigration attorneys and wealth managers.

Mideast Power Saudi Arabia Rejects Trump Proposal to Take Over Gaza

DUBAI-Saudi Arabia on Wednesday dismissed a proposal by President Trump for the U.S. to take control of Gaza and for Palestinians to permanently leave the strip, an idea likely to be also rejected by other Arab nations.

The kingdom said its commitment to a Palestinian state in Gaza and the West Bank was "firm and unwavering," and that Riyadh wouldn't establish diplomatic relations with Israel without that goal. "Achieving lasting and just peace is impossible without the Palestinian people obtaining their legitimate rights," Saudi Arabia's Foreign Ministry said.

Trump Campaigned on Ending Foreign Entanglements. Now He Wants to Own Gaza.

WASHINGTON-President Trump campaigned on shrinking America's role abroad. But since taking office, he has articulated a worldview that is at times closer to expansionism than isolationism.

Trump generated global shock waves Tuesday when he said the U.S. should take long-term control of Gaza, suggesting that Palestinians should be relocated while the enclave is rebuilt into the "Riviera of the Middle East." Secretary of State Marco Rubio wrote on social media that Trump would "Make Gaza Beautiful Again."

U.S. Postal Service Suspends Shipments of China Parcels

The U.S. Postal Service said it would stop accepting parcels from China and Hong Kong, cutting off a service that is popular with online vendors in China.

The Postal Service said it is suspending inbound packages from China Post and Hong Kong Post until further notice and that the change wouldn't affect delivery of letters.

data.title: Apple Stock Falls. Blame the U.S., China Trade Tensions. â Barrons.com
data.description:
By Elsa Ohlen

China has been a weak spot for Apple for some time. Trade tensions between Beijing and the U.S. certainly won't help.

Apple stock fell early Wednesday after a report said that China is looking into probing the iPhone maker's Apple App Store fees and practices.

Apple shares fell 2.5% to $226.90 in premarket trading Wednesday while futures tracking the Nasdaq were down about 1%.

China's State Administration for Market Regulation is preparing for a potential probe into how Apple deals with developers, including its 30% commission on in-app spending, according to a Bloomberg report citing people familiar with the matter.

Antitrust officials have been talking with both Apple representatives and app developers since 2024, the people said. Apple didn't immediately respond to a Barron's request for comment.

The news comes amid an escalating trade war between the world's second largest economy and the U.S. as Donald Trump returned to the White House just over two weeks ago.

President Trump imposed an additional 10% tariff on Chinese goods Tuesday, provoking retaliatory tariffs from China on imports from the U.S., expected to take effect from next week.

Apple stock fell 3.4% Monday amid a 1.2% drop in the Nasdaq Composite, before regaining 2.1% on Tuesday. Shares are down 7% so far this year.

Write to Elsa Ohlen at elsa.ohlen@barrons.com

This content was created by Barron's, which is operated by Dow Jones & Co. Barron's is published independently from Dow Jones Newswires and The Wall Street Journal.

data.title: Amcor plc SEC 10-Q Report
data.description:
Amcor plc, a global leader in packaging solutions, has released its Form 10-Q report for the second quarter of fiscal year 2024. The report highlights the company's financial and operational performance, showcasing both achievements and challenges faced during the period.

Financial Highlights

Amcor plc reported the following key financial metrics for the three months ended December 31,Â 2024:

  • Net Sales: $3,241 million, a slight decrease of $10 million compared to the same period last year, reflecting higher sales volumes offset by unfavorable price/mix impacts.
  • Gross Profit: $626 million, an increase of $5 million, driven by cost savings initiatives and increased sales volumes.
  • Operating Income: $297 million, representing 9.2% of net sales, up from 7.4% in the prior year period.
  • Net Income Attributable to Amcor plc: $163 million, an increase of $29 million or 22%, due to higher gross profit and other income.
  • Diluted EPS: $0.113, an increase of $0.021 or 23%, reflecting the increase in net income attributable to Amcor plc.

Business Highlights

Amcor plc's business performance for the second quarter of fiscal year 2024 includes the following operational highlights:

  • Revenue Segments:
    • The Flexibles segment reported net sales of $2,511 million, reflecting a 1% increase compared to the same period in 2023. This was driven by favorable volumes and the pass-through of higher raw material costs, partially offset by unfavorable price/mix impacts.
    • The Rigid Packaging segment experienced a 5% decrease in net sales to $730 million, primarily due to unfavorable price/mix impacts and the pass-through of lower raw material costs.
  • Geographical Performance:
    • In North America, net sales for the Flexibles segment increased to $980 million, while the Rigid Packaging segment saw a decrease to $519 million.
    • Latin America reported a decrease in net sales for both segments, with Flexibles at $250 million and Rigid Packaging at $211 million.
    • Europe maintained stable net sales for the Flexibles segment at $857 million, with no sales reported for Rigid Packaging.
    • In Asia Pacific, the Flexibles segment reported net sales of $424 million, showing growth compared to the previous year.
  • Sales Units:
    • The Flexibles segment saw a 3% increase in sales volumes, contributing to the overall growth in net sales.
    • The Rigid Packaging segment experienced a 1% increase in sales volumes, despite the overall net sales decline.
  • Future Outlook:
    • The company anticipates completing the merger with Berry Global Group, Inc. by mid-2025, which is expected to enhance its market position and operational capabilities.
    • Management expects to realize an annualized pre-tax benefit of approximately $50 million from structural cost reduction actions related to the 2023 Restructuring Plan by the end of fiscal year 2025.

SEC Filing: Amcor plc [ AMCR ] - 10-Q - Feb. 05, 2025

data.title: Doubleview Gold Corp Increases the Dimensions of the Hat Polymetallic Deposit with High-Grade and Extensive Mineralization in Drill Holes H075 to H077
data.description:
Vancouver, BC, Feb 5,Â 2025 - (ACN Newswire) - Vancouver, British Columbia--(Newsfile Corp. - February 5,Â 2025) - Doubleview Gold Corp. (OTCQB: DBLVF) (FSE: 1D4) (the "Company" or "Doubleview") is pleased to announce further drill hole results from the 2024 drill campaign at its 100% owned Polymetallic Hat Porphyry Project, located in northwestern British Columbia. Long copper-gold-silver-cobalt intercepts in Drill holes H075, H076 and H077 expand the mineralization and potentially will increase the Hat Project's resource in size and grade.

2024 Exploration:

The 2024 drilling program was designed to confirm the integrity of the resource estimate categories, particularly the indicated resource figures and potentially to allow elevating part or all to a measured resource. Holes were directed to intersect shallow mineralization and to further explore high grade zones. Drilling has confirmed the continuity of mineralization indicating that the deposit exhibits greater consistency than typically expected of a porphyry-style deposit.

Mr. Farshad Shirvani, president & CEO of Doubleview, states: "The 2024 drill campaign was successful in testing, confirming and improving our resource model. We are encouraged to see the occurrence of mineralization closer to the surface as well as strong mineralization drill holes which proves continuity and allows for more detailed structural interpretations. This will strongly reflect in the upcoming MRE.V 2.0 that will be part of Preliminary Economic Assessment (PEA) and add value to the Polymetallic Hat Deposit by increasing the metal content. We are continuously working on our exploration model as data becomes available to recognize details of the deposit and its critical and precious metals."

The following section illustrates drill holes H075 to H077 intersecting the Hat polymetallic deposit along the strike of major high-grade mineralization. (Section looking North East)

Cross Section Based on the Resource Block Model

To view an enhanced version of this graphic, please visit:https://images.newsfilecorp.com/files/8003/239700_d0b4e4fc24f26863_001full.jpg

Quality Assurance and Quality Control:

Hat Project drill cores are processed at Doubleview's camp where they are photographed, measured and logged by our technical staff and then divided using a diamond bladed saw. One half is placed in a stout bag to form the assay sample that is forwarded securely to the independent analytical lab. The remaining half core is stored on site where it is available for further examination and sampling. The assay cores are subject to a Chain of Custody routine as they are shipped from camp to a bonded carrier for delivery to the lab.

Core samples are analysed at the North Vancouver facility of ALS Canada Ltd. using their PREP-31, PGM-ICP24, ME-MS61, and ME-ICP06 packages. Each core sample is dried, then crushed to 70% passing a 2mm screen. All material is processed in an automatic Riffle splitter to yield a 250g homogenized, representative sample. This sub-sample is then pulverized to 85% passing a 75-micron screen. All samples are analyzed for Au, Pt, Pd by 50g fire-assay fusion/ICP-ES finish, using PGM-ICP24 package. A separate 0.25g pulp split is analyzed by Four Acid digestion/ICP-MS finish, reporting 48 elements. Over limit elements are analyzed by Ore Grade Four Acid digestion/ICP-ES finish using ME-OG62 assay package. All of Doubleview's core samples are analyzed or assayed at independent ISO 17025 and ISO 9001- certified laboratories.

When initial assays are received and accepted by our staff, a certain fraction of the samples will be sent to a second ISO-certified lab for check assay and verification purposes. Assays will be reported in News Releases.

Doubleview maintains a website at www.doubleview.ca.

Qualified Persons:

Erik Ostensoe, P. Geo., a consulting geologist, and Doubleview's Qualified Person with respect to the Hat Project as defined by National Instrument 43-101 Standards of Disclosure for Mineral Projects, has reviewed, and approved the technical contents of this news release. He is not independent of Doubleview as he is a shareholder in the company.

About Doubleview Gold Corp

A mineral resource exploration and development company is headquartered in Vancouver, British Columbia, Canada. It is publicly traded on the TSX-Venture Exchange , (OTCQB: DBLVF), (WKN: LA1W038), and (FSE: 1D4). Doubleview focuses on identifying, acquiring, and financing precious and base metal exploration projects across North America, with a strong emphasis on British Columbia. The company enhances shareholder value through the acquisition and exploration of high-quality gold, copper, cobalt, scandium, and silver projects-collectively critical minerals-utilizing cutting-edge exploration techniques.

Doubleview's success is deeply rooted in the unwavering support of its long-term shareholders, supporters, and institutional investors. Their ongoing commitment has been instrumental in advancing the company's strategic initiatives. Doubleview looks forward to further collaborative growth and development, and continues to welcome active participation from its valued stakeholders as the company expands its portfolio and strengthens its position in the critical minerals sector.

About the Hat Polymetallic Deposit

The Hat Deposit, located in northwestern British Columbia, is a polymetallic porphyry project with major resources of copper, gold, cobalt, and the potential for scandium. As one of the region's significant sources of critical minerals, the Hat deposit has undergone targeted exploration and development. Scandium potential for the Hat Deposit is estimated to be 300 to 500 million tonnes at an average grade of 40 ppm (0.004%) Sc2O3.

data.title: Bunge misses fourth-quarter profit estimates
data.description:
Bunge Global missed Wall Street's expectations for fourth-quarter profit on Wednesday, after a global glut in crop prices took a hit on the grain trader's margins.

Shares of the company fell 3.4% before the bell.

Corn, soybean and wheat prices hit four-year lows in 2024 as global stocks ballooned to multi-year highs, whittling down margins for agribusinesses.

Bunge and its peers make money by processing, trading and shipping crops around the world. On Tuesday, rival Archer-Daniels-Midland narrowly missed expectations for quarterly profit amid a slowdown in demand for staple crops.

Bunge's agribusiness segment, which represents over 80% of its total revenue, saw adjusted core earnings decline to $364 million in the fourth quarter from $639 million a year earlier.

Gross profit at its Refined and Specialty Oils segment fell 19.5% to $275 million in the fourth quarter.

Bunge forecast adjusted earnings to be $7.75 per share in 2025, missing analysts' expectations of $8.71.

The Missouri-based company posted an adjusted profit of $2.13 per share in the fourth quarter, compared with analysts' estimates of $2.24 according to data compiled by LSEG.

data.title: ING Comments on Euro, Poland's Zloty
data.description:
ING sticks to its call that will start to lose support once it crosses 1.040, as the euro remains broadly unattractive from a macro fundamental perspective and United States President Donald Trump has indicated that the European Union should be next on the tariff list.

A EUR:USD two-year swap rate gap at -185bps is a mirror of that â via the monetary policy channel â and a key disincentive to chase much higher, wrote the bank in a note.

Domestically, the eurozone calendar is relatively quiet for the remainder of the week, pointed out ING. Trade news will dominate , although the bank will be interested to hear whether the slightly hotter-than-expected inflation figures trigger some minor change in the narrative coming from European Central Bank officials.

ECB Chief Economist Philip Lane speaks later Wednesday.

downside remains interesting, stated ING. Japanese nominal cash wages accelerated to 4.8% year over year in December, well above the 3.7% consensus. Real earnings were up 0.6% year over year. That reinforces ING's call for two rate hikes by the Bank of Japan this year and improves the outlook for the yen.

Wenesday, Poland's central bank (NBP) is likely to leave rates unchanged again at 5.75% in line with expectations and market pricing. The decision itself should be a non-event.

Investors may get some information from the statement, which last sent a hawkish signal in January. However, the main event will be Governor Adam Glapinski's press conference on Thursday, added ING. The statement and press conference in January were strongly hawkish.

We can probably expect something similar on Wednesday and Thursday. However, it's hard to imagine at this point what more the governor might add to the hawkish message from January. ING believes the governor's hawkishness has run out and the market may see a more dovish NBP this week.

Despite all this, foreign exchange is the main winner of the whole story, with reaching its lowest levels in recent weeks since pre-COVID despite all the global volatility. In the bank's view, nothing will change on foreign exchange at the moment.

Due to the collapse in EUR rates, the interest rate differential has widened again and justifies the current lows in the 4.200-220 level in ING's view. Zloty rates are pricing in roughly 80bps of rate cuts for this year with the first move in July. The market is visibly focused on a peak in inflation and given the bank's current knowledge of the situation, pricing seems "fair."

data.title: Henan Jinma Energy Exceeds 2024 Limit for Coke Supply Contract; Pledges Stronger Controls
data.description:
Henan Jinma Energy exceeded the annual transaction limit under an agreement to supply coke to substantial shareholder Maanshan Iron & Steel for the year 2024 by around 3.4% or 40 million yuan, a Wednesday bourse filing said.

The sales department of the company failed to identify the transactions that caused the limit to be crossed in December 2024 and subsequently delayed the relevant delivery to the next month, January.

The firm termed the incident an isolated one caused by inadvertent oversight and will take steps to strengthen its internal control measures.

These measures will include improving its transaction monitoring and approval processes, as well as training the relevant employees.

data.title: These Stocks Are Moving the Most Today: Alphabet, AMD, Apple, Palantir, Novo Nordisk, FMC, PDD, Disney, and More â Barrons.com
data.description:
By Joe Woelfel

Stock futures were falling Wednesday after Google parent Alphabet reported quarterly revenue that missed Wall Street expectations and as investors awaited talks between President Donald Trump and Chinese President Xi Jinping amid a ramped-up trade war between the two countries.

These stocks were poised to make moves Wednesday

Alphabet, the parent company of search giant Google, reported fourth-quarter earnings that beat analysts' estimates but the stock was falling 7.1% after revenue of $96.47 billion missed forecasts of $96.68 billion. Revenue at Alphabet's cloud business during the quarter of $11.96 billion, up 30% from a year earlier, also missed expectations of $12.19 billion. The company said it plans to invest $75 billion in capital expenditures in 2025 as it expands its generative artificial-intelligence initiatives.

Advanced Micro Devices posted fourth-quarter adjusted earnings of $1.09 a share that edged past estimates of $1.08. Revenue was $7.7 billion, above analysts' expectations of $7.5 billion, but a jump in data-center revenue of 69% to $3.9 billion was shy of projections of $4.1 billion. The chip maker forecast first-quarter sales of $7.1 billion at the midpoint of its range versus estimates of $7 billion. AMD shares fell 8.7%.

Apple declined 2.6% following a report from Bloomberg that said China's antitrust watchdog was considering launching a probe into the tech giant's policies and the fees it charges app developers. The State Administration for Market Regulation has been examining Apple's policies, which include taking a cut of as much as 30% on in-app spending, Bloomberg reported, citing people familiar with the matter.

Palantir Technologies fell 1.2% in premarket trading after shares of the AI software company finished up 24% on Tuesday at a record closing high of $103.83. The stock also set an intraday record high Tuesday of $106.91 after Palantir topped Wall Street's quarterly earnings expectations.

FMC plunged 21% after the agricultural services company said it expects first-quarter sales of between $750 million and $800 million, a decline of 16% at the midpoint from a year earlier. Analysts had been anticipating revenue of $957 million. "Volume is expected to be lower as customers in many countries continue to reduce inventory and purchases are made cautiously by retailers and growers in an environment of lower commodity prices," FMC said in a statement.

Snap rose 1% after the parent company of Snapchat reported fourth-quarter adjusted earnings of 16 cents a share, beating Wall Street estimates by 2 cents. GAAP earnings in the quarter were 1 cent a share, a swing from a year-earlier loss of 15 cents. The company also reported better-than-expected revenue of $1.56 billion, and said global daily active users in the period were 453 million. Analysts expected of 451.1 million. Snap said it expects first-quarter revenue of $1.33 billion to $1.36 billion, up 12% from 2024 at the midpoint. Analysts were expecting $1.33 billion.

U.S.-listed shares of Novo Nordisk rose 3.4% after the Danish drugmaker reported fourth-quarter earnings that beat analysts' expectations but forecast slower growth ahead. Novo Nordisk is the maker the widely popular weight-loss and diabetes drugs Ozempic and Wegovy.

Amgen's fourth-quarter adjusted earnings of $5.31 a share topped expectations of $5.08 as revenue in the period rose 11% to $9.09 billion. The biotechnology company said 10 products delivered at least double-digit sales growth in the period. Amgen forecasts 2025 adjusted earnings of between $20 and $21.20 a share on revenue of between $34.3 billion and $35.7 billion. Wall Street expects adjusted earnings of $20.92 a share on revenue of $34.63 billion. The stock was down 1.6%.

Shares of Alibaba listed in the U.S. fell 2%, JD.com declined 2.7%, and PDD Holdings, the owner of popular Chinese shopping app Temu, slumped 6.3% as the Chinese e-commerce stocks took a hit from plans by the U.S. Postal Service to stop accepting parcels from China and Hong Kong.

Chipotle Mexican Grill was down 6% in premarket trading after the fast-casual restaurant chain posted solid fourth-quarter earnings but revenue of $2.8 billion missed analysts' expectations of $2.85 billion. Chipotle also reduced its fiscal year same-store sales outlook to an increase in the low to mid-single digits.

Enphase Energy said it anticipates first-quarter sales of between $340 million and $380 million, compared with analysts' consensus of $338 million. Shares of the solar-power company rose 6.3%.

Mattel surged 13% after the toy maker reported adjusted earnings of 35 cents a share in the fourth quarter on revenue of $1.65 billion, topping analysts' estimates on both metrics, and said it expects adjusted earnings of $1.66 to $1.72 a share in 2025, higher than estimates of $1.57.

Earnings reports are expected Wednesday from Walt Disney, Qualcomm, Ford Motor, Uber Technologies, Arm Holdings, and MicroStrategy.

Disney was up slightly in premarket trading. Wall Street expects the media and entertainment giant to report fourth-quarter earnings of $1.40 a share on total revenue of $23.9 billion, up 9% from a year earlier. Investors will be monitoring performance of Disney's experiences unit, which includes its struggling theme parks.

Write to Joe Woelfel at joseph.woelfel@barrons.com

This content was created by Barron's, which is operated by Dow Jones & Co. Barron's is published independently from Dow Jones Newswires and The Wall Street Journal.

data.title: Snap Inc SEC 10-K Report
data.description:
Snap Inc., a leading technology company known for its flagship product Snapchat, has released its annual Form 10-K report, detailing its financial and operational performance for the fiscal year. The report highlights significant improvements in revenue, a reduction in net loss, and strategic initiatives focused on augmented reality and community engagement.

Financial Highlights

  • Revenue: $5,361 million, reflecting a 16% increase year-over-year driven by an increase in global advertising impressions volume.
  • Cost of Revenue: $2,474 million, representing a 17% increase primarily due to higher infrastructure costs associated with DAU growth and investments in machine learning and AI.
  • Operating Loss: $(787) million, an improvement from the previous year's loss of $(1,398) million, attributed to increased revenue and reduced research and development expenses.
  • Net Loss: $(698) million, a significant reduction from the prior year's net loss of $(1,322) million, primarily due to increased revenue and cost management.
  • Net Loss Per Share: $(0.42), compared to $(0.82) in the previous year, indicating improved financial performance.

Business Highlights

  • Business Overview: Snap Inc. is a technology company focused on improving communication through its flagship product, Snapchat, a visual messaging application. The company emphasizes augmented reality (AR) experiences and visual messaging as key components of its platform.
  • Product Segments: Snapchat consists of five distinct tabs: Camera, Visual Messaging, Snap Map, Stories, and Spotlight. Each tab offers unique features such as AR Lenses, personalized maps, and curated content, enhancing user engagement and interaction.
  • Augmented Reality (AR) Focus: Snap Inc. is heavily investing in AR technology, offering millions of AR Lenses and developing Spectacles, wearable AR glasses, to extend AR experiences beyond the Snapchat app.
  • Partner Ecosystem: The company collaborates with developers, creators, publishers, and advertisers to enhance Snapchat's features and content. This ecosystem supports diverse content creation and monetization opportunities.
  • Advertising Products: Snap Inc. offers a range of advertising products, including AR Ads and Snap Ads, which leverage the platform's visual and interactive capabilities to engage users and provide value to advertisers.
  • Geographical Performance: The company reports user engagement and growth across different regions, with specific mention of North America, Europe, and the Rest of the World, highlighting varying growth rates and market characteristics.
  • User Metrics: Daily Active Users (DAUs) increased by 9% year-over-year, reaching 453 million in Q4Â 2024, indicating strong user engagement and platform growth.
  • Future Outlook: Snap Inc. is focused on growing its community, diversifying revenue streams, and investing in the future of augmented reality. The company aims to navigate macroeconomic challenges by prioritizing investments and enhancing user engagement.

Strategic Initiatives

  • Strategic Reprioritization: The company has undertaken a strategic reprioritization to focus on three key areas: growing its community and deepening engagement, accelerating and diversifying revenue growth, and investing in augmented reality. This includes changes to the advertising platform to enhance delivery and measurement capabilities, despite facing challenges from macroeconomic factors and increased competition.
  • Capital Management: The company issued $750 million in convertible senior notes due in 2030, with net proceeds of $671.5 million. It also repurchased $859 million of convertible notes and authorized a $500 million stock repurchase program, although no shares were repurchased under this program in the fourth quarter of 2024. Additionally, the company has a $1.05 billion revolving credit facility to support working capital and general corporate purposes.
  • Future Outlook: The company plans to continue its strategic focus on augmented reality and community engagement while managing macroeconomic challenges. It aims to maintain a strong liquidity position with $3.4 billion in cash, cash equivalents, and marketable securities, and will explore merger and acquisition opportunities that align with its strategic priorities. The company also anticipates ongoing competition in the advertising space, which may impact revenue growth.

Challenges and Risks

  • User Engagement and Growth: The company faces significant challenges related to user engagement and growth, as its daily active user (DAU) growth rate has declined in the past and may continue to do so. This is compounded by competition for user attention and the need to penetrate older demographics or developing markets, which may be more difficult and costly.
  • Advertising Revenue: The company generates the majority of its revenue from advertising, which is subject to fluctuations based on advertisers' perceptions of the effectiveness of its platform. Changes in data privacy regulations, such as those implemented by Apple and potentially by Google, have already impacted the company's ability to target and measure advertisements effectively, leading to reduced demand and pricing for advertising products.
  • Operational Dependencies: Operationally, the company relies heavily on Google Cloud and Amazon Web Services for its computing needs. Any disruption or unfavorable changes in terms by these providers could seriously harm operations. The company also faces risks related to intellectual property protection, as it relies on various legal protections that may not be enforceable in all jurisdictions.
  • Governance Risks: The co-founders' control over voting stock presents governance risks, as they can influence major decisions, potentially against the interests of other shareholders. Macroeconomic uncertainties, including inflation, supply chain disruptions, and geopolitical conflicts, could adversely impact advertising revenue and operational stability.
  • Cybersecurity Risks: The company is also exposed to cybersecurity risks, as it collects and processes sensitive information. Any breach or failure to protect this data could damage its reputation and lead to legal and regulatory consequences.
  • Management's Discussion and Analysis: Management acknowledges the challenges posed by declining user growth and increased competition. The company is focusing on product innovation and diversification of revenue streams, such as subscription models, to mitigate these risks. However, the success of these initiatives is uncertain, and the company may face increased costs and regulatory scrutiny.
  • Market Risks: The company is exposed to market risks, including fluctuations in advertising demand and pricing, which are influenced by broader economic conditions and changes in data privacy regulations. The reliance on third-party cloud services also presents operational risks that could impact financial performance if service disruptions occur.

SEC Filing: Snap Inc [ SNAP ] - 10-K - Feb. 04, 2025

data.title: OMNICOM GROUP INC. SEC 10-K Report
data.description:
Omnicom Group Inc., a leading global marketing and corporate communications company, has released its 2024 Form 10-K report, showcasing robust financial growth, strategic initiatives, and a forward-looking approach to business operations. The report highlights the company's performance across various segments, geographical regions, and outlines the strategic direction for future growth, including a significant merger with IPG.

Financial Highlights

  • Revenue: $15,689.1 million, reflecting a 6.8% increase from the previous year, driven by organic growth and acquisitions.
  • Operating Income: $2,274.6 million, an increase of 8.1% from the prior year, with an operating margin of 14.5%.
  • Net Income - Omnicom Group Inc.: $1,480.6 million, up by $89.2 million year-over-year, influenced by increased revenue and operational efficiencies.
  • Net Income Per Share - Omnicom Group Inc.: Diluted: $7.46, an increase of 8.0% from the previous year, supported by share repurchases and improved earnings.

Business Highlights

  • Revenue Segments: The company operates in several key disciplines, including Media & Advertising, Precision Marketing, Public Relations, Healthcare, Branding & Retail Commerce, Experiential, and Execution & Support. Media & Advertising is the largest segment, accounting for 54% of revenue in 2024.
  • Geographical Performance: North America showed strong performance with a 6.3% organic revenue growth, driven by Media & Advertising and Precision Marketing. Latin America experienced a 17.2% organic growth, led by Media & Advertising. Europe saw a 2.7% organic growth, with notable performance in Media & Advertising and Experiential disciplines.
  • Geographical Performance: In Asia-Pacific, organic revenue increased, particularly in China, India, Australia, the Philippines, and Thailand, despite currency challenges. The Middle East and Africa also saw growth in Media & Advertising and Experiential disciplines.
  • New Product Launches: The company announced the formation of Omnicom Advertising Group (OAG) in August 2024, a new global organization that aligns creative networks BBDO, DDB, and TBWA, which began operations in January 2025.
  • Future Outlook: The company anticipates that the merger with IPG, if completed, will have a material impact on business operations, results, and financial condition. The merger is expected to enhance the company's market position and service offerings.
  • Future Outlook: The company is focusing on leveraging generative AI to enhance service delivery and productivity, while being mindful of associated risks and privacy concerns. This is expected to significantly impact operations in the future.
  • Operational Strategy: The company continues to pursue a client-centric business model, organizing services around client needs and expanding service offerings through acquisitions and collaborations across its networks.
  • Operational Strategy: The company is committed to environmental sustainability, with initiatives focusing on emissions reductions and efficiency improvements, aligning with the UN Global Compact and Sustainable Development Goals.

Strategic Initiatives

  • Merger Agreement: The company entered into a Merger Agreement with IPG on December 8,Â 2024, which is expected to have a material impact on its business, results of operations, and financial condition.
  • Acquisitions: The company acquired Flywheel Digital in January 2024 for approximately $845 million to enhance its digital commerce capabilities.
  • New Organization: The company announced the formation of Omnicom Advertising Group, a new global organization to align its creative networks and agencies.
  • Capital Management: The company issued â¬600 million 3.70% Senior Notes due 2032 and $600 million 5.30% Senior Notes due 2034 to fund general corporate purposes, including acquisitions and stock repurchases. It repaid $750 million 3.65% Senior Notes on November 1,Â 2024. The company also repurchased $268.6 million of its common stock, net of proceeds from stock plans, and paid $552.7 million in dividends to common shareholders. The company maintains a $2.5 billion unsecured multi-currency revolving credit facility and has the ability to issue up to $2 billion of U.S. Dollar denominated commercial paper.
  • Future Outlook: The company plans to continue its strategic acquisition strategy, focusing on companies with strong entrepreneurial management teams to fill service delivery gaps. It also aims to leverage generative AI to enhance service delivery and productivity. The company expects foreign exchange rates to reduce revenue by 2.0% to 2.5% in the first quarter of 2025 and by 2.0% for the full year. The proposed merger with IPG is anticipated to significantly impact the company's strategic direction and financial performance.

Challenges and Risks

  • Merger Risks: The company is undergoing a significant merger with IPG, which introduces several risks including potential disruptions in business relationships, integration challenges, and the need for regulatory approvals. The merger is expected to have a material impact on the business, results of operations, and financial condition.
  • Economic Risks: The company faces risks from adverse economic conditions, including inflation, geopolitical events, and disruptions in credit markets, which could lead to reduced client spending and impact revenue.
  • Operational Risks: The company operates in a highly competitive industry and must remain competitive to retain key clients. The loss of major clients could significantly impact revenue.
  • Cybersecurity Risks: The company relies heavily on IT systems and faces evolving cybersecurity threats that could compromise data integrity and lead to financial and reputational damage.
  • AI Risks: The use of generative AI presents risks related to ethical considerations, regulatory compliance, and public perception, which could impact business operations.
  • International Risks: Currency exchange rate fluctuations and operations in high-growth markets pose risks due to economic and political uncertainties.
  • Regulatory Risks: Compliance with evolving data privacy laws and environmental, social, and governance expectations could lead to increased costs and liabilities.
  • Management Strategies: The company is closely monitoring global economic disruptions and client revenue levels to align its cost structure with changes in demand. The merger with IPG is expected to significantly impact the company's operations, and management is focused on realizing cost savings and synergies from the merger.
  • Market Risks: The company is exposed to market risks, including foreign currency exchange rate fluctuations, which could impact financial results. The company operates in over 50 currencies, and adverse fluctuations could affect revenue and profitability.

SEC Filing: OMNICOM GROUP INC. [ OMC ] - 10-K - Feb. 04, 2025

data.title: Alphabet Inc. SEC 10-K Report
data.description:
Alphabet Inc., the parent company of Google, has released its 2024Â 10-K report, showcasing a year of robust financial performance, significant business advancements, and strategic investments. The report highlights Alphabet's continued growth in its core services, cloud infrastructure, and AI integration, while also addressing the challenges and risks faced in a rapidly evolving technology landscape.

Financial Highlights

Alphabet Inc. reported strong financial results for 2024, driven by growth across its key business segments:

  • Total Revenues: $350,018 million, an increase of 14% year over year, primarily driven by an increase in Google Services revenues of $32.4 billion, or 12%, and an increase in Google Cloud revenues of $10.1 billion, or 31%.
  • Cost of Revenues: $146,306 million, an increase of 10% year over year, primarily driven by increases in content acquisition costs, TAC, and depreciation expense.
  • Operating Income: $112,390 million, an increase of 33% year over year, with an operating margin of 32%, up from 27% in the previous year.
  • Net Income: $100,118 million, an increase of 36% year over year, reflecting strong performance across Google Services and Google Cloud.
  • Diluted EPS: $8.04, an increase of 39% year over year, indicating improved profitability and efficiency.

Business Highlights

Alphabet Inc. made significant strides in its business operations, focusing on AI integration, cloud growth, and product innovation:

  • AI Integration: Google has integrated its Gemini AI model across all seven of its two billion-user products, including Android, Chrome, Gmail, Maps, Play Store, Search, and YouTube, enhancing user experience with advanced AI capabilities.
  • Google Cloud Growth: Google Cloud has seen significant growth, driven by its AI-optimized infrastructure and services, including the Vertex AI platform and Gemini for Google Cloud, which support enterprise innovation and cybersecurity.
  • Product Innovation: Google continues to innovate with new AI features such as AI Overviews and NotebookLM, which enhance user interaction by providing complex information breakdowns and summarizing sources.
  • Device Enhancements: The latest Pixel devices incorporate Gemini Nano, offering advanced AI-assistive experiences, and the Android and Chrome operating systems now include integrated AI features.
  • Moonshot Projects: Alphabet's Other Bets, including Waymo's autonomous driving technology, continue to develop, with Waymo now offering fully autonomous ride-hailing services in multiple cities.
  • Privacy and Security: Google prioritizes privacy and security by investing in secure-by-default products and responsible data practices, enhancing user control over their data.
  • Geographical Performance: The United States accounted for 49% of revenues in 2024, with EMEA at 29%, APAC at 16%, and Other Americas at 6%, reflecting a strong presence in the U.S. market.
  • Sustainability Goals: Alphabet aims to achieve net-zero emissions and 24/7 carbon-free energy by 2030, with significant investments in carbon removal solutions and renewable energy procurement.
  • Workforce and Culture: Alphabet had 183,323 employees as of December 31,Â 2024, emphasizing a collaborative and innovative work environment with industry-leading benefits and career development opportunities.
  • Future Outlook: Alphabet plans to continue investing in AI and technical infrastructure to support business growth and long-term initiatives, particularly in AI products and services.

Strategic Initiatives

Alphabet Inc. is focused on long-term growth through strategic investments and capital management:

  • Research and Development: Alphabet continues to invest heavily in research and development, particularly in AI and cloud services, to drive innovation and maintain competitive advantage.
  • Technical Infrastructure: The company is expanding its technical infrastructure, including servers and data centers, to support long-term growth and strategic initiatives.
  • Emerging Markets: Alphabet is investing in emerging markets to capitalize on the increasing online presence of users in these regions.
  • Capital Management: In 2024, Alphabet repurchased 379 million shares for $62.0 billion and declared dividends totaling $7.4 billion, marking the first time dividends were paid. The company also issued $13.6 billion in debt and repaid $12.7 billion, maintaining a strong liquidity position with $95.7 billion in cash, cash equivalents, and marketable securities. Capital expenditures increased to $52.5 billion, primarily for technical infrastructure investments.
  • Future Outlook: Alphabet plans to increase investments in technical infrastructure to support AI products and services, indicating a focus on long-term growth. The company intends to continue its share repurchase program with $44.7 billion remaining authorized for future repurchases. Alphabet also plans to maintain its dividend payments, subject to board approval, and expects its existing liquidity to be sufficient to fund operations and capital commitments for the foreseeable future.

Challenges and Risks

Alphabet Inc. faces several challenges and risks in maintaining its competitive edge and ensuring sustainable growth:

  • Market Risks: The company generates a significant portion of its revenue from online advertising, which is sensitive to economic conditions and competition. Changes in advertising policies, data privacy practices, and technologies that block or impair ads could harm the business.
  • Operational Risks: Intense competition requires continuous innovation and investment in technical infrastructure and R&D. The expansion into AI and cloud services demands significant resources and poses risks related to the availability and pricing of third-party equipment and infrastructure.
  • Regulatory Risks: Alphabet is subject to a wide range of laws and regulations, including those related to data privacy, AI, and content moderation. New regulations, such as the EU AI Act and Digital Markets Act, could impose significant compliance costs and operational challenges.
  • Emerging Risks: The development and use of AI may lead to reputational harm and increased liability exposure due to issues like harmful content, inaccuracies, and data privacy concerns. The company must navigate evolving laws and regulations related to AI and data protection.
  • Supply Chain Risks: Alphabet relies on third-party manufacturers and suppliers, which exposes it to risks related to supply shortages, price increases, and quality issues. Geopolitical tensions and natural disasters could further disrupt the supply chain.
  • Foreign Currency Risks: Alphabet is exposed to foreign currency exchange rate fluctuations, which may adversely affect its financial results. The company hedges a portion of its international currency exposure but remains vulnerable to significant exchange rate movements. Additionally, the fair value of investments may be impacted by market conditions, leading to potential volatility in financial performance.

SEC Filing: Alphabet Inc. [ GOOG ] - 10-K - Feb. 04, 2025

data.title: ARES CAPITAL CORP SEC 10-K Report
data.description:
Ares Capital Corporation, a leading specialty finance company, has released its annual Form 10-K report, detailing its financial and operational performance for the fiscal year ending December 31,Â 2024. The report highlights significant growth in investment income, strategic initiatives to enhance capital structure, and a robust outlook for future opportunities in the middle-market sector.

Financial Highlights

Total Investment Income: $2,990 million, reflecting an increase from the previous year primarily due to the increase in the average size of the portfolio.

Net Investment Income: $1,403 million, showing growth from the prior year, driven by higher interest income and capital structuring service fees.

Net Realized Losses on Investments: $(55) million, improved from the previous year's losses, with significant realized gains from certain portfolio companies.

Net Unrealized Gains on Investments: $188 million, indicating a positive change in the valuation of portfolio investments.

Net Increase in Stockholdersâ Equity Resulting from Operations: $1,522 million, consistent with the previous year, highlighting stable operational performance.

Business Highlights

Business Model: Ares Capital Corporation operates as a specialty finance company, primarily investing in U.S. middle-market companies through debt and equity investments. The company focuses on generating current income and capital appreciation.

Investment Strategy: The company invests mainly in first lien senior secured loans, second lien senior secured loans, subordinated debt, and preferred equity. It targets middle-market companies with annual EBITDA between $10 million and $250 million.

Market Position: As of December 31,Â 2024, Ares Capital was the largest publicly traded business development company (BDC) by market capitalization, with approximately $28.3 billion in total assets.

Geographical Performance: The company's investment portfolio is diversified across various regions, with significant investments in the West (25.2%), Midwest (20.9%), and Southeast (19.3%) regions of the United States.

Industry Focus: Ares Capital's portfolio is diversified across industries, with major investments in Software and Services (24.5%), Health Care Equipment and Services (12.0%), and Financial Services (9.9%).

Operational Structure: The company is externally managed by Ares Capital Management LLC, leveraging the resources and relationships of Ares Management Corporation to identify and manage investment opportunities.

Competitive Advantages: Ares Capital benefits from the Ares platform, which provides extensive deal flow, investment evaluation, and due diligence capabilities, along with a seasoned investment team and broad origination strategy.

Future Outlook: The company anticipates continued opportunities in the middle-market sector due to reduced competition from traditional banks and a large pool of un-invested private equity capital seeking debt financing.

Regulatory Structure: Ares Capital is regulated as a BDC under the Investment Company Act and has elected to be treated as a regulated investment company (RIC) under the Internal Revenue Code, which influences its investment and operational strategies.

Strategic Initiatives

Strategic Initiatives: The company has focused on strategic initiatives such as the establishment of the Senior Direct Lending Program (SDLP) in partnership with Varagon to provide first lien senior secured loans to U.S. middle-market companies. Additionally, the company completed two significant debt securitizations, ADL CLO 1 and ADL CLO 4, to enhance its capital structure and support its lending activities.

Capital Management: The company engaged in several capital management activities, including issuing and selling 65.2 million shares of common stock through 'at the market' offerings, generating net proceeds of $1.36 billion. It also repaid the 2024 Convertible Notes and the June 2024 Notes upon their maturity. The company maintained a stock repurchase program with $1.0 billion available for repurchases, although no shares were repurchased during the year. The company also managed its debt portfolio by maintaining various credit facilities and issuing new notes, resulting in a total debt outstanding of $13.8 billion as of December 31,Â 2024.

Future Outlook: The company plans to continue leveraging its strategic partnerships and securitization capabilities to support its lending activities. It aims to maintain a strong balance sheet by managing its debt levels and exploring opportunities for further equity offerings. The company also intends to utilize its stock repurchase program strategically, depending on market conditions and liquidity requirements.

Challenges and Risks

Challenges and Risks: The company faces significant risks due to potential disruptions and instability in the capital markets, which could adversely affect its ability to raise debt and equity capital. Global economic, political, and market conditions, including geopolitical tensions and inflation, exacerbate these risks. The company's reliance on key personnel and systems from Ares, as well as its competitive market for investment opportunities, further compounds operational risks. Additionally, the company's investments in middle-market companies, which are often illiquid and highly leveraged, pose substantial risks, especially during economic downturns.

The company is also exposed to regulatory risks, including maintaining its status as a Business Development Company (BDC) and a Regulated Investment Company (RIC). Failure to comply with these regulations could significantly impact its operational flexibility and tax obligations. Furthermore, the company must navigate complex regulations regarding transactions with affiliates, which could limit investment opportunities.

Emerging risks include increased scrutiny and potential regulatory changes related to Environmental, Social, and Governance (ESG) matters, which could impose additional costs and affect the company's reputation. The evolving landscape of artificial intelligence and its regulatory implications also present new challenges.

Management acknowledges the challenges posed by the current macroeconomic environment, including labor shortages, supply chain disruptions, and interest rate volatility. The company is focused on managing these risks through strategic investment decisions and maintaining a diversified portfolio to mitigate potential losses.

The company is subject to market risks, particularly interest rate fluctuations, which could impact its investment returns and net investment income. The use of leverage magnifies these risks, potentially leading to greater volatility in the company's financial performance. Additionally, the company faces risks related to the valuation of its investments, as most are not publicly traded and may be subject to significant unrealized depreciation during market downturns.

data.title: Visma Launches Compulsory Acquisition of Penneo Shares
data.description:
Visma Danmark Holding said Wednesday it is buying the remaining shares of Penneo through a compulsory acquisition at 16.5 Danish kroner apiece.

The remaining minority shareholders of the Danish software-as-a-service company have until March 5 to transfer their shares, with settlement scheduled later.

The last day of trading for Penneo shares on Nasdaq Copenhagen is also expected on the same day, subject to the delisting application's approval.

data.title: Market Chatter: Apple Could Face Antitrust Probe From China Over App Store Policies, Fees
data.description:
Apple may face an antitrust probe by China's State Administration for Market Regulation over Apple's App Store fees and practices, Bloomberg News reported Wednesday, citing sources with knowledge of the matter.

The review focuses on the US technology giant's policy of charging up to 30% commission on in-app purchases, as well as its ban on third-party payment methods and app stores, the report said.

SAMR officials have been in discussions with Apple executives and app developers since last year, amid long-running disputes with companies like Tencent and ByteDance, the report added.

An official investigation may be launched if Apple does not respond positively to the initial discussions, the report said.

SAMR, Apple, Tencent and ByteDance did not immediately respond to requests for comment from MT Newswires.

Shares of Apple were down about 2.7% in recent premarket activity.

(Market Chatter news is derived from conversations with market professionals globally. This information is believed to be from reliable sources but may include rumor and speculation. Accuracy is not guaranteed.)

data.title: Luxembourg Inflation Rate Rises to 6-Month High
data.description:
The annual inflation rate in Luxembourg rose to 1.94% in January 2025 from 1% in December 2024.

This marked the highest reading since July, as prices accelerated for food and non-alcoholic beverages (0.59% vs 0.5% in December), transports (1.55% vs 0.95%), alcoholic beverages and tobacco (2.59% vs 2.48%), and hotels, cafes, and restaurants (3.08% vs 2.86%).

Moreover, prices rebounded sharply for housing and utilities (5.53% vs -1.84%).

Meanwhile, costs slowed for clothing and footwear (0.6% vs 1.23%), health (1.15% vs 1.18%), recreation and culture (1.27% vs 4.88%), and miscellaneous goods and services (0.87% vs 1.75%).

On a monthly basis, consumer prices edged higher to 0.4% in January 2025 from 0.1% in December 2024.

KOF: Swiss Business Situation Weakens in January
data.description:
The KOF Business Situation Indicator for the Swiss private sector declined in January, mainly driven by weakness in the manufacturing industry.

Based on the KOF Business Tendency Surveys published Wednesday, the index fell to 12.5 in January from 14.3 in the previous month. Companies also turned a little more cautious about business expectations over the next six months, according to the Swiss research institute.

Ares Management Corporation Reports Fourth Quarter and Full Year 2024 Results
data.description:
Ares Management Corporation Reports Fourth Quarter and Full Year 2024 Results

NEW YORK--(BUSINESS WIRE)--February 05,Â 2025--

Ares Management Corporation today reported its financial results for its fourth quarter and full year ended December 31,Â 2024.

GAAP net income attributable to Ares Management Corporation was $177.3 million for the quarter ended December 31,Â 2024. On a basic and diluted basis, net income attributable to Ares Management Corporation per share of Class A and non-voting common stock was $0.72 for the quarter ended December 31,Â 2024.

After-tax realized income was $434.7 million for the quarter ended December 31,Â 2024. After-tax realized income per share of Class A common stock was $1.23 for the quarter ended December 31,Â 2024. Fee related earnings were $396.2 million for the quarter ended December 31,Â 2024.

"During 2024, we set many financial records, including our best year ever in gross fundraising and capital deployed. We raised $93 billion of new funds in 2024 and ended the year with $484 billion of AUM," said Michael Arougheti, Chief Executive Officer of Ares. "We continued to expand our investment platform, diversify our distribution channels across institutional, wealth and insurance and generate compelling investment performance for our investors. As we head into 2025, we are optimistic that we are entering into a more active transaction environment which should create more investment opportunities for our platform."

"With a record $95 billion of assets under management not yet paying fees, we are well positioned to invest opportunistically across a broad range of our strategies for investors and to drive continued strong growth in our key financial metrics over the next several years," said Jarrod Phillips, Chief Financial Officer of Ares. "We are making excellent progress on GCP International and we now expect the transaction will close in the first quarter. We believe the GCP International business we are acquiring is well positioned and we expect progress on a number of new fundraising initiatives this year."

Common Stock Dividend

Ares declared a quarterly dividend of $1.12 per share of its Class A and non-voting common stock, payable on March 31,Â 2025 to its Class A and non-voting common stockholders of record at the close of business on March 17,Â 2025.

Preferred Stock Dividend

Ares declared a quarterly dividend of $0.84375 per share of its 6.75% Series B mandatory convertible preferred stock, payable on April 1,Â 2025 to its preferred stockholders of record at the close of business on March 15,Â 2025.

Dividend Reinvestment Program

Ares has a Dividend Reinvestment Program for its Class A common stockholders that will be effective for the quarterly dividend on March 31,Â 2025. Equiniti Trust Company is engaged to administer the plan on behalf of Ares. Additional information can be located on the Investor Resources section of our website.

Additional Information

Ares issued a full detailed presentation of its fourth quarter and full year 2024 results, which can be viewed at www.aresmgmt.com on the Investor Resources section of our home page under Events and Presentations. The presentation is titled "Fourth Quarter and Full Year 2024 Earnings Presentation."

2025 Annual Stockholders Meeting

The Board of Directors set April 7,Â 2025 as the record date for Ares' 2025 Annual Meeting of Stockholders. The 2025 Annual Meeting of Stockholders will be held on June 6,Â 2025.

Conference Call and Webcast Information

Ares will host a conference call on February 5,Â 2025 at 10:00 a.m. (Eastern Time) to discuss fourth quarter and full year results. All interested parties are invited to participate via telephone or the live webcast, which will be hosted on a webcast link located on the Home page of the Investor Resources section of our website at http://www.aresmgmt.com. Please visit the website to test your connection before the webcast. Domestic callers can access the conference call by dialing +1 (800) 343-5172. International callers can access the conference call by dialing +1 (203) 518-9856. All callers are asked to dial in 10-15 minutes prior to the call so that name and company information can be collected and to reference the conference ID ARESQ424. For interested parties, an archived replay of the call will be available through March 5,Â 2025 to domestic callers by dialing +1 (800) 839-2475 and to international callers by dialing +1 (402) 220-7220. An archived replay will also be available through March 5,Â 2025 on a webcast link located on the Home page of the Investor Resources section of our website.

About Ares Management Corporation

Ares Management Corporation is a leading global alternative investment manager offering clients complementary primary and secondary investment solutions across the credit, real estate, private equity and infrastructure asset classes. We seek to provide flexible capital to support businesses and create value for our stakeholders and within our communities. By collaborating across our investment groups, we aim to generate consistent and attractive investment returns throughout market cycles. As of December 31,Â 2024, Ares Management Corporation's global platform had over $484 billion of assets under management, with operations across North America, Europe, Asia Pacific and the Middle East.
